page.title: 01The Vale of Lorton
page.content: This is a completely rural area. To the south the land is high, the lower slopes of the mountains of Cumbria. The land slopes steeply down to past- ures.The river Cocker flows through these fields. The area lies just within the western boundary of the Lake district national park. It is beautiful and unspoiled development is strictly controlled by the L D S P B. The main industry is farming-cattle & sheep and milk production. Some people provide accommodation for tourists- bed and breakfast 1 hotel, 1 public house, 2 caravan sites and the letting of holiday cottages. This block contains details of church & SCHOOL but it is an account of part of a community. The village of High Lorton is described in the adjacent block.
